item.title: Drain is partially blocked, 6th October
item.description:
When you get moderate rainfall, the drain does not allow the water to run away. It blocks half of the road with water. It does seep away after a while but pedestrians cannot walk of the pavement without the fear of getting wet from passing vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken metal cover, 6th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Bala Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Lights out - AGAIN, 5th October
item.description:
We’re back to the same old story. Things get fixed poorly and half-heartedly, so instead of a permanent solution, it’s just a patch-up job. As a result, not long after the supposed fix, it breaks down again, and we’re back to square one, having to file complaints. This leads to yet another temporary fix, causing inconvenience to the neighbours and wasting both time and money for the council. So why not, once and for all, properly fix the streetlight that has broken for the millionth time and has been out for over a month, leaving the street as dark as a cave and unsafe to walk through? I’ve also seen that it was reported again on the 15th of September, yet nothing has changed – we’re still without light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1a, Elmfield Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
